name: Hotel Villa Gabrisa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It would be easy to write several paragraphs about how lucky we were to find this hotel but we hope our genuine rating of all aspects of this hotel will reflect what an impression it made on us.
reviews.title: Such a delightful place to stay

reviews.text: The owners and their family couldn't have been more helpful and supportive; the service was excellent and always attentive; the facilities gave us all that we wanted for the type of holiday we were looking for.
reviews.title: Villa Gabrisa has Gorgeous Amalfi Views

reviews.text: The accommodation (we had a suite on the first floor) was superb - it was spacious and comfortable with a balcony that gave us great views out to sea and to some of the scenery surrounding Positano.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positano itself is lovely town being far less commercialised than some other parts of the Amalfi Coast and it was so well positioned for visiting other local attractions including Capri, Amalfi, Sorrento, Pompeii, Vesuvius. It is easier of you have a car though and Positano does have a lot of hills and steps to descend and climb - but it's good exercise.
reviews.title: An unforgivable place !

reviews.text: We ate in the restaurant on several occasions (dinner, lunch and breakfast) through choice and not as part of a meal plan as the food was excellent with a good selection of local wines too - with good advice on what to try available too.
reviews.title: Lovely stay in off season, last week of...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positano is absolutely beautiful. So tranquil - it was a great start to our honeymoon (part 2 was Sorrento which is nice but I think we were spoiled by the time we got there). The town is set on the side of the cliff so it is full of winding streets up and down which is tiring but adds to the scenery.
reviews.title: Good accomodation - beautiful town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In all our travels around Positano, I didnt really see any standout accommodation - maybe its a good thing - a great big hotel would probably spoil the place. It seemed like there are just a handfull of rooms in Villa Gabrisa - we didnt see more than about 3 other couples at breakfast. Speaking of which - breakfast was grand but basic - cereals, fruit and some lovely breads. The highlight was probably the excellent cappucinos which were served up in the attractive local ceramic cups (we had to buy some before we left - probably spent way too much on an olive oil dispenser but it is a nice keepsake).
reviews.title: Super tiny rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in an attic room which was a bit of a tight squeeze - bedroom and bathroom were quite small but adequate. Staff were good throughout.
reviews.title: Heavenly retreat above the madding crowds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would love to go back to Positano - if I could afford a bigger room in Villa Gabrisa I would be there in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: A great, family run, hotel and restaurant. Well located too.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a good deal, so I guess we got the smallest rooms on the very top. I am from Switzerland and used to small rooms but that room was small. bathroom was nice size compare to the room, and has all you need.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay and very gracious hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been suggested by a friend and I never could imagine how beautiful is this place.The suite was really amazing, spacious and felt just like being at home.The view is really great .I also suggest to try the restaurant ''Da Gabrisa'' wich by my opinion is one of the best there.
reviews.title: Incredible view and amazing room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautifull accomondation. My retreat to a perfectly romantic weekend in positano !
reviews.title: beautifull place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely wonderfull and helpfull family that runs the place. Gabriele was allways arround and helpfull to any question we had. Our room had a balcony that gave a beautiful view over the sea. Great location, bit away from the busier part of town. just as we liked it. Loved our stay there and will definately return !
reviews.title: A lovely friendly hotel in a beautiful setting....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have just returned from a wonderful weekend at Villa Gabrisa. We had a suite (the one with blue furntiure on the hotel's own website) which was perfect for us.
reviews.title: The best choice in Positano!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel owner, Gabriele, worked tirelessly, and was always on hand to give advice, serve drinks or attend to whatever was required. He recommended a small trattoria which was uphill, but worth the effort!
reviews.title: Ridiculously Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here in July 2009 for three nights.
reviews.title: Nice views - would stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: On the upper third of the hill, about a 20-25 minute walk to the beach, you can either take the steps which are a little faster but strenuous if hot/humid out, or you can take the road which is a bit longer, and you will need to dodge cars on certain parts (no sidewalk). The quality of the accommodation and fabulous views was worth the extra walk for us. I should note however, there is a busy you can take down, we just never did.
reviews.title: One of top 5 hotels I have ever stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast: we sat outside every morning for the buffet breakfast, beautiful views, such a great way to start the day. Very good assortment for breakfast.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location and Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms/amenities: we had booked an attic room, but when we got there they actually gave us one of the larger rooms on the second floor, it was huge, with a lovely small terrace. The room was clean with AC, TV. Only complaint was we had to have our faucet fixed, and the cover for the shower drain was missing, but they couldn’t do anything about it, can’t remember why (maybe because it was the weekend).
reviews.title: Amazing stay
Restaurant is definitely worth a visit
reviews.text: Suggestions: I wasn’t a huge fan of the food in Positano (maybe because I’m Italian I’m too harsh of a judge, but I think the quality was less because it is so heavily touristed). The dish I’m a fan of though (and I did manage to find a restaurant that made it well, would recommend it, but can’t remember the name, was by the beach steps, not on the sea front, but up past the steps, a local recommended it), was melanzane all parmigiana (eggplant layered with sauce and cheese).

description: In a residential area, in the heart of Positano, there is located the ancient building which guests the hotel Villa Gabrisa, an elegant and refined hotel owned by the Rispoli family. The careful choice of each detail, just like Murano chandeliers or Capodimonte ceramics, makes every room special and the hotel's privileged position, just few minute walk from the beaches, wraps it in a fairytale atmosphere that every guest can feel it from each room balcony or terrace, which overlooks the sea.
